title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe the trend in electricity production from coal between 2009 and 2019, such as any of the following:

· The electricity produced from coal declined significantly between 2009 and 2019.

· The percent of electricity generated from coal declined from approximately 36% in 2009 to approximately 20% in 2019.

· The percent of electricity generated from coal decreased by approximately 16% from 2009 to 2019.

The response describes the trend in electricity production from coal between 2009 and 2019, such as one of the following:

· The electricity produced from coal declined significantly between 2009 and 2019.

· The percent of electricity generated from coal declined from approximately 36% in 2009 to approximately 20% in 2019.

· The percent of electricity generated from coal decreased by approximately 16% from 2009 to 2019.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples andto score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe an environmental change that is likely to have occurred in the state of Texas that resulted from the change in wind production indicated in the graphs between 2009 and 2019, such as any of the following:

· The area of land devoted to wind turbines/wind farms increased.

· If open prairie land was used for wind farms, then some habitat loss/loss of biodiversity (e.g., prairie dog habitat) would have occurred.

· There was an increase in noise levels from wind turbine operation.

· Land was converted from agricultural field to wind farms.

· There was an increase in bird/bat deaths from increased collisions with wind turbines.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify and describe one renewable energy source that could be used in electricity production in the state of Texas that was not being used in 2019, such as any of the following:

· Biomass can be burned directly to heat water to its boiling point, and then the steam is sent through a steam turbine, which then generates electricity.

· Geothermal energy could be produced by building geothermal power plants in areas where heat stored in the Earth’s interior can be used to heat water and turn a generator.

· Wet biomass (e.g. food waste and manure) can be partially converted into methane ( CH 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@386F@ ) in a digestion tank, then the methane and the syngas can be used in a gas engine or a gas turbine for electricity production.

· Tidal power/tidal energy could be produced through the use of underwater turbines placed in areas with high tidal movements.

The response identifies and describes one renewable energy source that could be used in electricity production in the state of Texas that was not being used in 2019, such as one of the following:

· Biomass can be burned directly to heat water to its boiling point, and then the steam is sent through a steam turbine, which then generates electricity.

· Geothermal energy could be produced by building geothermal power plants in areas where heat stored in the Earth’s interior can be used to heat water and turn a generator.

· Wet biomass (e.g. food waste and manure) can be partially converted into methane ( CH 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@386F@ ) in a digestion tank, then the methane and the syngas can be used in a gas engine or a gas turbine for electricity production.

· Tidal power/tidal energy could be produced through the use of underwater turbines placed in areas with high tidal movements.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not explain how government subsidies for energy production by solar power in the form of a consumer tax credit would affect the energy production by coal in 2030 in Texas, such as the following:

· Electricity generated by coal in Texas would likely continue to decline if subsidies were provided to facilities using solar power because there would be increased investment in solar energy/increased cost for coal electricity generation, which would make it less economically viable for energy production. These subsidies could also apply to individuals.

title: Part E

descriptions:

title: Part F
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does notdescribe one way that residents in Los Angeles could reduce the number of days per year that hazardous levels of tropospheric ozone are present, such as any of the following:

· Residents could walk or bike for local errands instead of driving.

· Residents could use public transit or rideshare with others.

· Residents could combine many errands into one trip instead of one trip per errand.

· Residents could move closer to their workplace to decrease the driving distance.

· Residents could replace their gasoline-powered cars with electric cars.

title: Part J
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not explain how the modification to only collect particulate matter from dual-powered motor vehicles, such as a hybrid electric and gasoline car, would alter the results of the investigation, such as the following:

· The vehicle would have zero tailpipe particulate matter if the hybrid vehicle was running in electric mode and would emit particulate matter running on gasoline, so the total amount of particulates release in a time period would vary depending on mode.
